revised_title: The Recovery of the Dutch Frigate Ambuscade: A Case Study in Salvage and Engineering
tldr: The sinking of the Dutch Frigate Ambuscade is investigated, with a focus on the recovery process. Mr. Joseph Whidbey details the methods used to raise the sunken vessel, including the use of another Dutch ship and four lighters. The paper also discusses the potential application of these techniques to other salvage operations, such as the recovery of the Royal George.
